sourceText: Keeping your family healthy and safe from COVID-19 can feel even harder when you live in crowded conditions.
text: Keeping your family healthy and safe from COVID-19 can feel even harder when you live in crowded conditions.

sourceText: There are things you can do to make this easier for your family.
text: There are things you can do to make this easier for your family.

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: For more information click below links:

sourceText: Keep using these tips
text: Keep using these tips

sourceText: Help your children with physical distancing.
text: Help your children with physical distancing.

sourceText: Explain to your children that they have an important job of keeping themselves and their community healthy by temporarily physically distancing from others.
text: Explain to your children that they have an important job of keeping themselves and their community healthy by temporarily physically distancing from others.

sourceText: Show them extra positive attention when they make an effort to practice safe physical distancing from others.
text: Show them extra positive attention when they make an effort to practice safe physical distancing from others.

sourceText: Make handwashing and hygiene fun!
text: Make handwashing and hygiene fun!

sourceText: It might be hard to find soap and water, but practicing good hygiene is more important now than ever.
text: It might be hard to find soap and water, but practicing good hygiene is more important now than ever.

sourceText: Try to wash all family members’ hands as often as possible with soap and water.
text: Try to wash all family members’ hands as often as possible with soap and water.

sourceText: Help children teach each other how to wash their hands with soap and water.
text: Help children teach each other how to wash their hands with soap and water.

sourceText: Encourage children to avoid touching their face.
text: Encourage children to avoid touching their face.

sourceText: Keeping positive, having a routine and trying to get some one-to-one time with each child when you can will help you manage your children’s behaviours and your feelings.
text: Keeping positive, having a routine and trying to get some one-to-one time with each child when you can will help you manage your children’s behaviours and your feelings.

sourceText: Take a Pause.
text: Take a Pause.

sourceText: You might not have space to yourself to deal with all the stress and emotions you are feeling.
text: You might not have space to yourself to deal with all the stress and emotions you are feeling.

sourceText: Notice when you are feeling stressed or upset and take a pause…even three deep breaths can make a difference!
text: Notice when you are feeling stressed or upset and take a pause…even three deep breaths can make a difference!

sourceText: Well done! Millions of families find that this helps.
text: Well done! Millions of families find that this helps.

sourceText: Exercise daily.
text: Exercise daily.

sourceText: Encourage children to think of activities they can do to exercise while avoiding contact with people who do not already live in your immediate space.
text: Encourage children to think of activities they can do to exercise while avoiding contact with people who do not already live in your immediate space.

sourceText: Jumping activities, dancing or running in circles can be fun!
text: Jumping activities, dancing or running in circles can be fun!

sourceText: Share the load.
text: Share the load.

sourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult in cramped spaces, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared.
text: Looking after children and other family members is difficult in cramped spaces, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared.

sourceText: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.
text: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.

sourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household.
text: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household.

sourceText: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.
text: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.

text: tips from WHO

text: tips from UNICEF

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Covid-19 Parenting

sourceText: Parenting in Crowded Homes and Communities
text: Parenting in Crowded Homes and Communities

sourceText: Keep staying safe.
text: Keep staying safe.

sourceText: Limit those leaving and returning to your immediate living space to as few and as infrequent as possible.
text: Limit those leaving and returning to your immediate living space to as few and as infrequent as possible.

sourceText: Know the COVID-19 rules about what you can and can’t do in your area.
text: Know the COVID-19 rules about what you can and can’t do in your area.
